intro:
Software engineer, gamer.
Childish, but not immature.
Will converse about anything.

post.body: So... noticed that I can create empty new sites on the ZeroNet homepage, how do I go about adding code/pages to it, and what technology does it use (I assume it's some Python library)

I don't want to be here, but I need to support alt-tech.
What ever happened to "Don't be evil"?

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/?1JQCnij7UvWdvcAHnZ4eDnSA88UsQR8puQ_2

That was written by a shill.
I checked his profile on Twitter, here:
https://twitter.com/timmyrsde

He works in "hosting solutions" which will be obsolete if ZeroNet takes off.

ZeroNet is such a small project, yet there are already shills trying to destroy it.

comment.body:
@Faith: I see. Looks like the site is stored locally, and getting a domain name requires some bitcoin mining.
Looks like a lot of Javascript... damn.

@Piloth: Can't get the email echobot to send a message back to me, and every mail site has its own user-base, which makes it kind of silly and not very usable.
It's more messaging service than email.

Other than that, it's certainly interesting.

I saw "Crypto for CP" in ZeroSites, that's creepy.
But besides that, it's not bad.

@Piloth: Got it, thanks!
At least that works.

I tried setting up ZeroNet on android, and it's a bit of a mess, with only certain browsers working, and importing my account requires some tinkering.

Most site do work though, but I couldn't share a new one I created. :(
@Piloth: Do you have link? I couldn't find anything using Zoogle :(

@Faith: Thanks for the list.
I'm a software engineer, but I work on C# / Java.
I know all those languages, but not well enough to make a decent website.
Time to hit the books!

@Glightstar: Thanks, I'll check out those... libraries? are those what they are? I'm really lost when it comes to Javascript.
Regarding Domain names, you are correct, but it said on the Namecoin website that mining BitCoin also grants domain names, though I didn't look into how exactly that is done.
I'm really not into the whole BitCoin thing.
â™¦ How do I mark files as optional, that's obviously important.
Can you link me to a tutorial or something?
@Glightstar: Fantastic! That's exactly what I was looking for, thanks!
